p: Virola oleifera is a semideciduous tree growing 20–30 m tall; the bole, which is usually straight and cylindrical, can be free of branches for up to 21 m, and it is 50–90 cm in diameter [ 10]. This species has oblong or linear leaves with parallel characteristic margins, about four times longer than wide, and powdery young lateral branches, which are few and short, with ovoid–ellipsoid fruits; it is acute or spat at the apex [ 9].
